change.changenote: Section 11 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 147/2012, effective June 25, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: In this section, ground activity means any work, operation or activity that results in a disturbance of the earth, including a mining activity as defined in section 1 of the Mines Act, but not including

paragraph.paragraphtext: cultivation to a depth of less than 45 cm below the surface of the ground, and
a disturbance, other than cultivation referred to in paragraph (a), of the earth to a depth of less than 30 cm.

subsection.subsectiontext: A ground activity is a prescribed activity for the purposes of section 76 (1) (b) of the Act.
The following distances are prescribed for the purposes of section 76 (1) of the Act:

paragraph.paragraphtext: 40 m, for any activity other than the prescribed activity referred to in subsection (2);
40 m, for the prescribed activity referred to in subsection (2).

definition.def: means a person to whom an approval under section 76 (1) (d) of the Act has been given;
means the construction or activity approved by an order issued under section 76 (1) (d) of the Act;
means an approval holder that is the government, a municipality, or the British Columbia Railway Company.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsections (4) to (6), an approval holder is responsible for all costs incurred by the approval holder in carrying out an approved action.

Subject to subsections (4) to (6), an approval holder is responsible for any costs incurred by a pipeline permit holder as a result of the approval holder's carrying out of an approved action, including, without limitation, costs

paragraph.paragraphtext: to realign, raise or lower the pipeline;
to excavate material from around the pipeline, and
to add casing or other appurtenances that an official considers necessary for the protection of the pipeline.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to an order issued under section 76 (6) of the Act and to subsection (5) of this section, a specified approval holder is not responsible for any costs incurred by a pipeline permit holder as a result of the carrying out of an approved action.
The costs referred to in subsection (4) must be shared equally between the specified approval holder and the pipeline permit holder if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the specified approval holder is a municipality, and
the approved action is the construction of a new highway within the boundaries of that municipality on either an existing right of way or on a newly dedicated right of way.

subsection.subsectiontext: The costs incurred by a pipeline permit holder as the result of the carrying out of an approved action must be shared equally between the approval holder and the pipeline permit holder if the approved action is the construction of a new road for a subdivision within a municipality.

change.changenote: Section 28 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 62/2019, effective April 1, 2019.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The collector must, on or about the 23rd day of the second calendar month after each production month, invoice each producer for an amount equal to the aggregate of the following calculations:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the marketable gas tax rate in effect for the production month multiplied by the volume of marketable gas produced by the producer in the month;
the petroleum tax rate in effect for the production month multiplied by the volume of petroleum produced by the producer in the month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A producer who receives an invoice from the collector must, before the end of the calendar month in which the invoice is received, pay to the collector, in the manner specified by the collector, the amount stated in the invoice.

If a producer is not in agreement with the amount invoiced by the collector, the collector must review the invoice if, within 90 days of the date the collector gave the invoice to the producer, the producer gives the collector a request for a review with reasons for the disagreement and any supporting documentation.
A producer who requests a review under subsection (3) is not exempted from the requirement to pay under subsection (2).
If the collector reviews an invoice under subsection (3) and determines that the position of the producer is correct, the collector must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: invoice the producer for any additional tax owing, or
credit the producer, on the next invoice, for any overpayment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a tax payment is not made within the time period set out in subsection (2), the collector may impose on the producer a penalty of $50 or 5% of the unpaid invoice amount, whichever is greater.
If a penalty is assessed under subsection (6), the collector must give notice of that penalty to the producer at the earliest opportunity.
If the production volumes used to invoice a producer under subsection (1) are adjusted after the invoice has been sent, the collector must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: invoice the producer for any additional tax owing, or
credit the producer, on the next invoice, for any overpayment.
